definition[0]: used to show that two people or teams are competing against each other in a game or court case
example[0]: the New York Knicks versus the LA Lakers
example[1]: the Supreme Court decision in Roe vs. Wade
definition[1]: used when comparing the advantages of two different things, ideas etc
example[2]: The finance minister must weigh up the benefits of a tax cut versus those of increased public spending.
definition[2]: used to show that two people or companies are against each other in a legal case
example[3]: The judge agreed with the decision in White versus Illinois.
